question: Henry has a plant stand at the town square. He sells three kinds of plants: tulips, roses and lilies. He usually sells tulips for £2.2328571428571427 per bouquet, roses for £4.526923076923078 per bouquet and lilies for £5.8580000000000005 per bouquet. Henry has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Henry sells 13 bouquets of tulips, 22 bouquets of roses and 36 bouquets of lilies, how much will he make?
answer:
Henry will round his tulips up from £2.2328571428571427 to £2, since the number following the 2 is 5 or higher.
Henry will round his roses up from £4.526923076923078 to £5, since the number following the 4 is 5 or higher.
Henry will round his lilies up from £5.8580000000000005 to £6, since the number following the 5 is 5 or higher.
Henry sells 13 tulips*£2 = £<<13*2=26>>26
Henry sells 22 roses*£5 = £<<22*5=110>>110
Henry sells 36 lilies*£6 = £<<36*6=216>>216
Altogether, Henry will make £26 + £110 + £216 = £<<26+110+216=352>>352
#### 352
